title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use "a" as the number of adult tickets and "c" as the number of childrens tickets. The total number of tickets combined is $$72$$, therefore we can determine that the first equation is $$a+c=72$$
speech: Let's use "a" as the number of adult tickets and "c" as the number of childrens tickets. The total number of tickets combined is , 72 , therefore we can determine that the first equation is  a, plus c, is equal to 72

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount of money made was $1,200 and adult tickets are $22 and childrens $10 we can determine that the second equation is $$22a+10c=1, 200$$
speech: Because the total amount of money made was $1,200 and adult tickets are $22 and childrens $10 we can determine that the second equation is  22 a plus 10 c is equal to 1200

title: Isolate Variable
text: Let's use the first equation to isolate c. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get $$c=72-a$$
speech: Let's use the first equation to isolate c. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get , c is equal to 72 minus a

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$c=72-a$$ using the second equation to get $$22a+\operatorname{10}\left(72-a\right)=1, 200$$
speech: We can plug in  c is equal to 72 minus, a  using the second equation to get  22 a, plus, 10 of, parentheses 72 minus a,  is equal to 1200

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation after plugging in "c" would be $$12a+720=1, 200$$. We now isolate the variable "a" and get $$12a=480$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$12$$ to get $$a=40$$.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for "a", we can plug that value into the first equation to get $$40+c=72$$ which we can determine "c" to be $$32$$.
speech: After solving for "a", we can plug that value into the first equation to get , 40 plus c, is equal to 72  which we can determine "c" to be  32 .
